Package ui

Class GLCamManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • ui.GLCamManager
  • public class GLCamManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Handle all camera motion including smooth motions, click-to-coordinate mapping, etc. Update should be called in every graphics draw.
    Author:
    Matt

    • Field Summary

        public void update​(com.jogamp.opengl.GL2 gl,
                   com.jogamp.opengl.glu.GLU glu)

        public javax.vecmath.Vector3f windowFrameToWorldFrameDiff​(int mouseXnew,
                                                          int mouseYnew,
                                                          int mouseXold,
                                                          int mouseYold)
        Transform a 2d coordinate click in window coordinates to a 3d coordinate in the world frame.

      • twistCW

        public void twistCW​(float radians)
        Twist up vector by provided angle

      • smoothZoom

        public void smoothZoom​(float zoomFactor,
                       int speed)
        Zoom in/zoom out. Also spread out over a certain number of update calls to smooth it out.
        Parameters:
        zoomFactor - How the current zoom factor is changed, multiplicatively, by this zoom. So, 1 is no change, <1 is zoom in. >1 is zoom out.
        speed - Number of timesteps that this change is spread over.

      • smoothTwist

        public void smoothTwist​(float zoomFactor,
                        int speed)
        Rotate the camera about the axis it's aiming

      • smoothRotateLong

        public void smoothRotateLong​(float magnitude,
                             int speed)
        Orbit camera longitudinally by a magnitude in radians with a speed factor of 'speed.' The speed means how many update calls does it take to achieve the change.

      • smoothRotateLat

        public void smoothRotateLat​(float magnitude,
                            int speed)
        Orbit camera latitudinally by a magnitude in radians with a speed factor of 'speed'. The speed means how many update calls does it take to achieve the change.

      • smoothTranslateAbsolute

        public void smoothTranslateAbsolute​(javax.vecmath.Vector3f campos,
                                    javax.vecmath.Vector3f tarpos,
                                    int speed)
        Move camera eye and target positions to absolute positions given. This will be done in speed number of update calls.

      • smoothTranslateRelative

        public void smoothTranslateRelative​(javax.vecmath.Vector3f campos,
                                    javax.vecmath.Vector3f tarpos,
                                    int speed)
        Move camera eye and target by offset amounts given. This will be done in speed number of update calls.

      • rotateLatitude

        public void rotateLatitude​(float magnitude)
        User interaction to rotate the camera latitudinally. Magnitude of rotation is in radians and may be negative.

      • rotateLongitude

        public void rotateLongitude​(float magnitude)
        User interaction to rotate the camera longitudinally. Magnitude of rotation is in radians and may be negative.

      • nodeFromRay

        public Node nodeFromRay​(javax.vecmath.Vector3f clickVec,
                        Node root)
        Take a click vector, find the nearest Node to this line.
        Parameters:
        clickVec - Click direction as defined by the view frustum.
        root - Root of a tree. All the nodes in this tree will be evaluated to find the closest.
        Returns:
        Nearest Node to the click ray.
        See Also:
        clickVector(int, int)

      • nodeFromClick

        public Node nodeFromClick​(int mouseX,
                          int mouseY,
                          Node root)
        Return the closest node to a click.

                              int mouseY,
                              java.util.List<Node> snapshotLeaves)
        Given a set of nodes

      • planePtFromRay

        public javax.vecmath.Vector3f planePtFromRay​(int mouseX,
                                             int mouseY,
                                             float levelset)
        Take a click vector, find the coordinates of the projected point at a given level. Note: assumes trees always stay perpendicular to the z-axis.

      • getZoomFactor

        public float getZoomFactor()
        Keeping zoom factor private to keep meddling without using the correct functions.
